intro: Myrcia neovenulosa, commonly known as the Brazilian myrtle, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to Brazil and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, fragrant white flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are elliptical, glossy, and have a distinctive aromatic scent when crushed. The fruit is a small, woody capsule that contains several seeds, contributing to its ecological importance in its native habitat.
